item.title: Pokemon TCG Pocket Player Recreates Mew Immersive Card Art in Gen 1 Style
item.description:
Summary

  • A Pokemon TCG Pocket player reimagined Mew's Immersive card.
  • This Mew card requires collecting all 150 Kanto Pokemon.
  • The Mythical Island mini-set release shook up the meta.

A talented Pokemon TCG Pocket player has recreated the artwork for Mew's immersive card in Gen 1 style and shared the result with the community. Of over 200 Pokemon TCG Pocket cards of varying rarities for players to collect, the Mew immersive card is considered especially difficult to acquire.

Pokemon TCG Pocket immersive cards need a lot of luck to acquire since they tend to have a considerably low drop rate. The Mew card is no exception , as Pokemon TCG Pocket players need to grab all 150 Kanto region Pokemon. Fulfilling this requirement takes time and patience, and although the Mew immersive card is not the most powerful–it only deals 20 damage–its artwork is one of the most adorable.

Redditor bebelhl turned the immersive Mew card into a poster, achieving an impressive result. Their artwork depicts the card's animation as a complete landscape, drawn with the aesthetic that made the first Pokemon generation one of the most beloved by fans. The Mythical Pokemon from Kanto appears flying over a river, encountering other critters such as two Fearow flying, a Snorlax sleeping while a Ditto is in its belly, and a Digglet in a cave.

The Mew Cards Available in Pokemon TCG Pocket

While the immersive card requires a specific step-by-step to unlock, other Mew cards are available following the release of Pokemon TCG Pocket 's Mythical Island mini-set. One Mew card sports a silver border, while the ex-cards boast stunning illustrations. Mew ex-cards feature art with a golden background and are considered some of the rarest in the game. Pokemon TCG Pocket players can also pull the standard Mew ex and a special variant with a colored border using some of the game's most detailed artwork.

Beyond introducing new Mew cards, the arrival of the Mythical Island mini-set introduced players to cards that have shaken up the meta. Among them is the powerful Serperior and Celebi ex combo that became quite popular in the first few days after launch, but ran into unexpected counters with Jynx. Pokemon TCG Pocket has also been adding new promotional cards from events. The latest wave is available in the new Solo Battle event, which features a full Blastoise art card as the main reward.

item.title: Elden Ring: 17 Best Ashes Of War, Ranked
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Savage Lion's Claw
  • Palm Blast
  • Storm Blade
  • Mighty Shot
  • Sacred Blade
  • Lion's Claw
  • Hoarfrost Stomp
  • Waves of Darkness
  • Bloodhound's Step
  • Carian Greatsword
  • Seppuku
  • Hoarah Loux's Earthshaker
  • Glintblade Phalanx
  • Thunderbolt
  • Gravitas
  • Carian Grandeur
  • Bloody Slash

It's no secret that combat in Elden Ring can get really hard, really quickly. Oftentimes, standing a chance against some of the game's most powerful foes requires taking a step back and leveling up a bit before facing them again. Applying Ashes of War to armaments grants access to some incredibly powerful attacks that can turn the tides of battle around.

Ashes of War aren't universal solutions to every conflict in Elden Ring, though. Many of them are only applicable to certain types of weapons, and some of their effects may not be as effective, depending on which enemies they're used for. Nevertheless, some of Elden Ring's Ashes of War are much better than others, and knowing of their existence early on in the game can help new players a lot.

Updated January 4, 2025 by Erik Petrovich : In Elden Ring, item descriptions can be found on every item in the game, from consumables to key items to weapons and armor pieces, of course. One place many players don't realize has item descriptions are Ashes of War – including Ashes of War that are only available as the default skill on specific weapons. Though each of these best Elden Ring Ash of War weapon skills' item descriptions mostly describe the actions players will take when cast, some also reveal more details about the origins of the skill, or the history of its creator or previous wielder. This guide to the best Ashes of War in Elden Ring has been updated to include these descriptions, which shed light on the specific actions for each Ash of War and reveal some information about each weapon skills' place in the lore.

​​​​​​

17 Savage Lion's Claw

A Better Version Of An Already Strong Ash of War

Skill of the particularly brave, even among the Redmanes.

Somersault forwards, striking foes.

An additional strike may be performed with an additional input.

Applicable Weapon Types

Default Affinity

All Axes, Hammers, and Swords (small weapons and thrusting weapons excempt)

Heavy

The Savage Lion's Claw is arguably the best Elden Ring DLC Ash of War because it is essentially a stronger version of Lion's Claw, one of the base game's best weapon skills. It is faster, deals more damage, has a follow-up, and costs the same amount of FP to execute.

This Ash of War can be put onto just about any weapon in the game, except small weapons like Fists, Beast Claws, and Daggers – but it's especially strong on Great Hammers and Colossal Weapons for the sheer amount of Poise damage it's capable of.

Savage Lion's Claw Location

To get the Savage Lion's Claw, find the Three-Path Cross Site of Grace just north of the starting point for the Elden Ring DLC, then head north while hugging the cliffside wall to the west. You should find the Savage Lion's Claw Ash of War on the ground in a small camp about a 20 seconds' ride north of the cave that leads to Belurat.

16 Palm Blast

Dryleaf Arts Only – But Well Worth The Second Weapon Slot

Skill of the spiritual seekers known as the Dryleaf Sect.

Imbues hand with energy before using a palm strike to unleash an explosive blast.

The already formidable power and impact can be bolstered by charging the attack.

Applicable Weapon Types

Default Affinity

Unique to the Dryleaf Arts weapon type, but can be altered

Quality

Palm Blast is one of the best DLC Ashes of War because, like Savage Lion's Claw, it doesn't cost a lot, deals a ton of damage, and is capable of breaking all but the most stalwart enemy's Stagger meter, interrupting attacks or outright breaking their Poise.

The one downside is that you have to charge up the attack before it reaches full effectiveness. But when timed well, if you can hit an enemy with a full charge of this skill, and follow up with a Heavy Attack, you're all but guaranteed a Critical Hit. To take advantage of this Poise-breaking skill, consider equipping a Colossal Weapon (or something that can do a lot of damage in one hit) to take advantage of the regular Critical Hits you will be able to get.

Palm Blast Location

To be able to use the Palm Blast Ash of War, you must equip the Dryleaf Arts weapon, as this Ash of War cannot be used with any other weapon type and comes as the default skill on these weapons. However, the trade-off here is negligible, as Dryleaf Arts don't weigh much and you can easily swap to it when needed instead of changing your whole build.

15 Storm Blade

Rapid Mid-Range Attacks For Melee Builds

Lost skill of Stormveil.

Surround armament with shearing storm winds that can be fired forward.

Can be fired in rapid succession.

Applicable Weapon Types

Default Affinity

All Swords except colossal weapons & Twinblades

Quality

Especially useful for strength-focused builds, the Ash of War: Storm Blade is favored by players reliant on melee weapons precisely because it allows them to carry out devastating ranged attacks at a very low FP cost.

This is one of the best Ashes of War Elden Ring players can get because it grants access to a fast ranged attack to traditionally melee-only builds. Strength builds in particular can benefit from this, though it performs best when scaling off of both Strength and Dexterity with its default Quality affinity.

Storm Blade Location

To get Ash of War: Storm Blade, Elden Ring players should head to the Warmaster's Shack in Stormhill, Limgrave. Follow the path leading towards Stormveil's entrance, then head eastward into the forest before the path winds back to Margit's boss room. In the Warmaster's Shack, or at his secondary location within Volcano Manor, Knight Bernahl sells Storm Blade for 1800 Runes.

14 Mighty Shot

Arguably The Best Ranged Ash of War

Archery skill performed from a stance.

Ready the bow, then pull the bowstring to its limit to enhance the power of the shot, penetrating the enemy's guard.

Applicable Weapon Types

Default Affinity

Light and Medium Bows

Standard

Ash of War: Mighty Shot is actually the default skill on the Longbow in Elden Ring, but it can be applied to other bows in the form of an Ash of War. When used, it releases a shot that is much more powerful than the regular arrow hit.

Although it may not be as flashy as some of the other Ashes of War mentioned below, Mighty Shot is an absolute must-own for ranged builds. Particularly useful when trying to stealthily take down larger groups of enemies, it is also helpful when taking bosses on from a distance.

Mighty Shot Location

To get Ash of War: Mighty Shot, Elden Ring players must find a Scarab in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Castle Morne Ramparts Site of Lost Grace, ride Torrent northwest along the path until you see the Scarab. Mighty Shot is very commonly the default Ash of War on most Bows, though it can't be transferred without the actual Ash of War: Mighty Shot "item".

13 Sacred Blade

Handy Extra Holy Damage For Applicable Weapon Types

Grants armament's attacks holy essence and fires off a golden blade projectile.

The armament retains its holy essence for awhile.

Applicable Weapon Types

Default Affinity

All melee weapons except Whips, Fists, & Claws

Sacred

Ash of War: Sacred Blade is a multilayered one. It fires off a golden blade projectile when activated, which deals quite a bit of damage and is a great skill to use for players who want to open up a fight with a bit of an advantage.

However, the projectile is only surface-level stuff. Players with STR/FTH builds will appreciate this Ash of War greatly, as it adds Faith scaling to the weapon it is used on. Finally, it also buffs the weapon with 85 Holy damage for 20 seconds. It can be used on all melee armaments, except for claws, fists, and whips.

Sacred Blade Location

To get Ash of War: Sacred Blade, Elden Ring players must head to the Third Church of Marika. Mount Torrent and head northwest from this Site of Grace until you pass a small nearby pond. Defeat the Scarab that appears near this pond to get Sacred Blade.

12 Lion's Claw

A Rapid Strike From The Air, Like A Stormveil Lion

Skill of the Redmanes, who fought alongside the General Radahn.

Somersault forwards, striking foes.

Applicable Weapon Types

Default Affinity

Axes, Hammers, & Swords

Heavy

While using an Intelligence or Faith-focused build is probably the easiest way to blast through Elden Ring and reach one of its endings, FromSoftware definitely makes it worthwhile for players to try out a Strength-based build at least once by continuing to buff Ashes of War that gel really well with strength-based, melee-focused play styles.

Ash of War: Lion's Claw is one of such Ashes. It slams foes into the ground, taking away a good chunk of their health and stunning them for a brief moment. It was a powerful Ash of War ever since release day, but players often complained about how slow it was. That all changed with the rollout of Patch 1.04, which radically increased the speed of this Ash. In the right hands, this skill can get incredibly overpowered.

Lion's Claw Location

To get Ash of War: Lion's Claw, Elden Ring players must defeat the Lion Guardian in Fort Gael. This Lion Guardian his right in the middle of the Fort, which itself is located on top of the western cliffs of Caelid.

11 Hoarfrost Stomp

Once Super Overpowered, Now Just Regular Overpowered

Stomp to spread a trail of freezing mist on the ground.

The mist applies the frost status effect.

Applicable Weapon Types

Default Affinity

All melee weapons

Cold

The Hoarfrost Stomp Ash of War is one of the most powerful skills that can be found very early in the game. Ash of War: Hoarfrost Stomp can deal some hefty AoE damage and build significant Frostbite at the same time, for just 10 FP.

The skill emits a trail of freezing mist on the ground in front of the player, dealing loads of damage to any and all enemies that fall into its area of effect. Due to its low FP cost and frost-dealing qualities, players can use it in quick succession to inflict Frostbite to greatly weaken mobs.

Hoarfrost Stomp Location

To get Ash of War: Hoarfrost Stomp, Elden Ring players must look for a Scarab near Caria Manor. After beating Caria Manor, head immediately right from the manor's rear exit towards the Three Sisters, then head south. You should end up on the east side of the Manor, where you should look for a pond that the Scarab sits in.

10 Waves of Darkness

Magic Waves Of Energy Radiate Outward Three Times

Plunge armament into the ground to release three waves of darkness.

Follow up with a strong attack to swing the armament in a sweeping strike.

Applicable Weapon Types

Default Affinity

Great Axes, Great Hammers, Great Spears, & Colossal weapons

Magic

Ash of War: Waves of Darkness is a situationally useful Ash of War, but in those situations, it's ridiculously good. Just like in the boss fight against the Astel, this Ash of War lets players slam their weapon into the ground and emit three fast waves of damage.

It's all but unavoidable, though it is better against large groups of enemies than in a 1v1 fight. Use this Ash of War for AoE situations, but swap to something faster and less interruptible during a faster-paced boss fight.

Waves of Darkness Location

To get Ash of War: Waves of Darkness, Elden Ring players must defeat Astel, Naturalborn of the Void, and trade its Remembrance with Enia at Roundtable Hold. Astel is found towards the end of the Lake of Rot, as part of Ranni's questline.

9 Bloodhound's Step

Dashing Around At The Speed Of Sound

Skill that allows the user to become temporarily invisible while dodging at high speed.

Moves faster and travels farther than a regular quickstep.

This skill can be used to circle around lock-on targets.

Applicable Weapon Types

Default Affinity

All melee weapons

Keen

Ash of War: Bloodhound's Step is one of the most useful weapon skills in Elden Ring because it allows even high-weight players to move around the battlefield effortlessly and efficiently. When using Bloodhound Step, the Tarnished will dodge to the side about as far as a Light Roll, and do it with more i-frames than a normal dodge – in all ways it's an improved version of the basic Quickstep Ash of War.

Though less powerful than it once was towards Elden Ring 's launch, it's still essentially a better dodge, one that lets players go further, avoid damage easier and be ready to attack sooner.

Bloodhound's Step Location

To get Ash of War: Bloodhound's Step, Elden Ring players must defeat the Night's Cavalry open-world boss in the Dragonbarrow, just outside of Lenne's Rise on its eastern side. It's also the default Ash of War on the Bloodhound Claws weapon.

8 Carian Greatsword

Enormous Magic Blade That Gets Bigger When Charged

Transform blade into a magical greatsword and swing it down.

Can be charged to increase its power.

Applicable Weapon Types

Default Affinity

All swords, except Colossal swords

Magic

Ash of War: Carian Greatsword is an exceptional Ash of War for battlemage-type characters. The Carian Greatsword skill transforms the user's sword into a magical blade that deals a ton of damage and can be charged to increase both its damage and size.

Players who don't like the fuss and time consumption of certain Ashes of War will love this one, as it's an endgame-appropriate Ash of War that can be found very early in the game. It can be applied to all swords, excluding Colossal weapons.

Carian Greatsword Location

To get Ash of War: Carian Greatsword, Elden Ring players must find Sorcerer Rogier in Stormveil Castle and purchase it from him for 2,500 Runes. It can also be found in his inventory when he returns to Roundtable Hold after Godrick is defeated.

7 Seppuku

Self-Inflicted Damage To Buff Damage Output

A forbidden technique used by swordsmen from the Land of Reeds.

Plunge the blade into your stomach to stain it with blood.

Increases attack power and improves ability to inflict blood loss.

Applicable Weapon Types

Default Affinity

Thrusting Swords & Polearms, except Small and Colossal weapons

Blood

Ash of War: Seppuku is perhaps one of the coolest Ashes of War in all of Elden Ring. Inspired by a Samurai honorable suicide ritual, this Ash has the player character stab themselves in the stomach, covering their blade in blood. It doesn't cost too much HP, and the buff is more than worth it.

After the self-piercing animation, the blade will have increased attack power and ability to inflict blood loss on enemies for 60 seconds. A minute is a long time on the battlefield in Elden Ring, and it can surely be enough to quickly clear out an area.

Seppuku Location

To get Ash of War: Seppuku, Elden Ring players must reach the Mountaintops of Giants after defeating Morgott the Omen King. Head to the Frozen Lake on the east side of the area and head all the way north, almost to about parallel with Castle Sol. Look for an invisible Scarab here that moves around a tree surrounded by jellyfish – its path is telegraphed with a set of white footprints traveling in a circle around this tree.

6 Hoarah Loux's Earthshaker

A Colossal Weapon Ash of War That's Faster Than It Seems

Slam both hands onto the ground to violently shake the earth and unleash a shockwave.

Follow up with an additional input to slam the ground again.

Applicable Weapon Types

Default Affinity

Usable on all melee weapons

Heavy

Similarly to the Lion's Claw Ash of War, Ash of War: Hoarah Loux's Earthshaker was a skill that frustrated many players because it was quite strong on paper but too slow to use as a main Ash of War. With the arrival of Patch 1.04 (which also improved Lion's Claw), the Earthshaker was sped up significantly.

The first blow has a much shorter preceding animation, and the second one arrives almost immediately afterward, which is a game changer in terms of the efficiency of this Ash.

Hoarah Loux's Earthshaker Location

To get Ash of War: Hoarah Loux's Earthshaker, Elden Ring players must acquire Hoarah Loux's Remembrance, which itself is dropped by Godfrey, the Elden Lord, upon defeat near the very end of the game. That makes this Ash a great choice for a New Game+ playthrough for Strength builds, as it is one of the few Ashes of War that works with Colossal weapons.

5 Glintblade Phalanx

The Best Defense Is A Magical Offense

Skill used by the enchanted knights who served the Carian royal family.

Form an arch of magic glintblades overhead, which will attack foes automatically.

Applicable Weapon Types

Default Affinity

Thusting Swords and Polearms, except Colossal weapons

Magic

The Ash of War: Glintblade Phalanx creates an arch of magic blades over the caster's head. These blades automatically attack nearby enemies, dealing a great deal of damage. They are also extremely effective when fighting a single enemy and trying to swiftly break their stance.

One of the best things about Ash of War: Glintblade Phalanx is that it does not have any Intelligence requirements, as opposed to its actual Sorcery counterpart. Just like Glintstone Pebble, this ability pairs exceptionally well with an all-in-melee character who wants to incorporate some Sorceries and Ranged attacks into their playstyle.

Glintblade Phalanx Location

To get Ash of War: Glintblade Phalanx, Elden Ring players must purchase it from Sorcerer Rogier in Roundtable Hold after defeating Godrick the Grafted, or after acquiring the Royal House Scroll. Rogier will give you his sword with the Glintblade Phalanx ability already on it, though any Sorcery vendor will sell the Ash of War itself once you give them the Royal House Scroll for 2,500 Runes.

4 Thunderbolt

One Of The Best PvP Ashes of War – And Flashy, Too

Skill used by the capital's Ancient Dragon Cult.

Raise armament aloft to call down a bolt of lightning.

Can be fired in rapid succession.

Applicable Weapon Types

Default Affinity

All melee weapons

Lightning

The Ash of War: Thunderbolt is another skill that doesn't require too much FP to use but is very effective against nearly all kinds of foes. It deals Lightnig damage and can be used from an enormous range. It is also extremely versatile: Ash of War: Thunderbolt can be used on all melee weapons with no exceptions.

You won't be able to get Thunderbolt until around halfway through the game in Leyndell. But the skill is well worth the wait, though, as it allows players to unleash deadly bolts of lightning in rapid succession for a measly 10 FP with little delay between casts.

Thunderbolt Location

To get Ash of War: Thunderbolt, Elden Ring players must get to Leyndell and find the body of Gransax. After getting to the Avenue Balcony Site of Grace, head down the stairs and look for the courtyard where the dead dragon lays. Near the bottom of Gransax' body you should find a Scarab beetle. Kill this Scarab to get the Ash of War.

3 Gravitas

Don't Let Them Get Away, Ever Again

Skill originating from the Alabaster Lords, who had skin of stone.

Thrust the armament into the ground to create a gravity well.

In addition to dealing damage, this attack pulls enemies in.

Applicable Weapon Types

Default Affinity

All melee weapons, except Whips and Small weapons

Magic

This particular Ash of War isn't powerful because of the damage it deals, but rather due to its sheer usefulness on the battlefield. Many enemies, particularly wild beasts, deal a lot of damage by lashing or jumping onto the player from a distance.

Ash of War: Gravitas creates a "gravity well" that pulls all nearby enemies towards the player. This takes away the advantage of distance away from enemies, as well as granting players the window of opportunity to deal a great deal of damage to numerous enemies at once.

Gravitas Location

To get Ash of War: Gravitas, Elden Ring players must defeat the Alabaster Lord near the Seaside Ruins Site of Grace in Limgrave. From Castle Morne, head northward along the path and take a right into the woods before entering the ravine. You should run into a number of Gravity-magic-wielding enemies, and what looks like a portal. Walk up to the portal to summon the boss, and defeat it to get the Gravitas Ash of War.

2 Carian Grandeur

Fast Magic Blade That Can Also Be Charged

Carian royal prestige embodied in a skill.

Transform blade into magical greatsword and swing it down.

Can be charged to increase its power by up to two more levels.

Applicable Weapon Types

Default Affinity

All Swords, except Colossal weapons

Magic

Before the release of Patch 1.04, the Ash of War: Carian Grandeur Ash of War was snubbed by most players in favor of its higher-damage-dealing relative, the Carian Greatsword. However, after the arrival of that update, the tables have turned somewhat on the Carian Ashes of War.

Carian Grandeur's attack speed and charging rate have been significantly increased, and although it still deals less damage than the Greatsword Ash, it is a lot more convenient to use in close-quarters combat thanks to its quicker recharge times. STR/INT builds were already at an advantage compared to others, but with this Carian Grandeur buff, they can blast through hordes of enemies even faster.

Carian Grandeur Location

To get Ash of War: Carian Grandeur, Elden Ring players must head to Caria Manor, in the northwest of Liurnia of the Lakes, and get almost all the way through the dungeon. Just before entering the final boss room, you will see an off-shoot room that leads outside to the left. Head here, jump down the wooden scaffolding, and avoid the Warrior Jars.

Head down the cliffside, jumping from rocky platform to rocky platform, until you land on top of a fortress wall. Carian Grandeur is located on a body on this wall.

1 Bloody Slash

The Best Ash of War (In The Hands Of The Best PvPers)

Blood Oath skill granted by the Lord of Blood.

From a low stance, coat the blade in your own blood to unleash a rending blood slash in a wide arc.

Applicable Weapon Types

Default Affinity

All Swords, except Colossal weapons

Blood

While there are quite a few skills and Ashes of War that deal a lot more damage than Bloody Slash, not many of them come at such a low cost and high speed of use.

Aside from granting the Blood affinity to the weapon it is applied to, Bloody Slash is a powerful move that takes away a good chunk of the enemy's health. As far as early game Ashes of War go, this might just be the very best one. It can one-shot most of the mobs found along the way, as well as break the stance of many bosses with a single hit.

Bloody Slash Location

To get Ash of War: Bloody Slash , Elden Ring players must head to Fort Haight at the south of the Mistwood, in eastern Limgrave. At the top of Fort Haight there is a Blood Knight, who must be defeated as part of Kenneth Haight's questline. This miniboss also drops the Bloody Slash Ash of War.

item.title: 2022 LEGO Game Drops To Lowest-Ever Price Across Multiple Platforms
item.description:
Summary

  • LEGO Bricktales is currently on sale at a record low price of $7.49.
  • The 2022 LEGO game has thus dropped to its lowest-ever price across multiple storefronts.
  • PC and console gamers can take advantage of the ongoing LEGO Bricktales deals until next week.

LEGO Bricktales has recently been treated to some heavy discounts, reaching up to 75%. The ongoing offers bring the Thunderful-published LEGO game down to its lowest ever price across multiple platforms and storefronts.

Developed by Innsbruck, Austria-based ClockStone Studio, LEGO Bricktales is a puzzle adventure game that doubles as a virtual building sandbox. LEGO Bricktales was originally released for PC and consoles in October 2022 before making its way to Android and iOS devices in April of the following year. It debuted with a $29.99 launch price, which has seen consistent drops thanks to frequent sales.

In yet another testament to this trend, Swedish publisher Thunderful treated LEGO Bricktales to a string of discounts spanning multiple platforms. The ongoing promotion, which kicked off in late December, slashed the price of the PC version of the game to $7.49, or 75% off. The Nintendo Switch port of the colorful adventure game can also currently be picked up at the same price point. Both deals are noteworthy for marking the lowest price that LEGO Bricktales has ever reached on either platform.

At the same time, PlayStation 5 owners can presently pick up ClockStone Studio's latest game at 70% off, or $8.99. This is another best-ever price that's nominally ($0.90) lower than LEGO Bricktales ' prior lowest price on the PS Store, at least if not accounting for service-specific promotions. Namely, PS Plus members were recently able to pick up the 2022 LEGO game for $8.39 as one of their membership perks, although that offer wasn't as globally widespread as this ongoing sale.

The LEGO Bricktales Meta Quest port has also been treated to a hefty price cut as part of this holiday sale. The VR version of the game can hence currently be picked up for $9.99—or 66% off—via the Meta Store. As with the rest of this batch of deals, the Meta Quest offer marks the game's lowest-ever price on the platform. Steam users have until Thursday, January 9, to grab LEGO Bricktales at its best price to date. Meanwhile, the console versions of the game are only planned to remain on sale until the 6th or 7th of the month, depending on the platform.

While it didn't establish itself as a massive commercial hit, LEGO Bricktales was met with near-universal critical acclaim, as reflected in its "Mighty" rating on OpenCritic, based on an average score of 85 and a head-turning 100% reviewer recommendation rate. The game presently also boasts nearly 1,000 "Very Positive" user reviews on Steam, as well as 3.4- and 3.84- star player ratings on the Xbox and PlayStation Stores, respectively.

item.title: Baldur's Gate 3: 12 Best Feats For Monks
item.description:
Summary

  • The Alert feat grants a +5 initiative bonus, crucial for Monks to act early in combat and prevent surprises.
  • The Athlete feat boosts core skills, movement abilities, and jump distance for Monks seeking agility.
  • The Ability Score Improvement feat boosts Dexterity by +4 for Monks, ensuring hits and improved attacks.

Baldur's Gate 3 is based on Dungeons & Dragons rules when it comes to character creation, which means that every player has to choose certain Feats to give their custom character unique powers and abilities. Typically, players will get three opportunities across the game to learn a feat, with Monks learning feats at levels four, eight, and twelve.

Each Feat is an opportunity to upgrade a character, and some can turn any Monk into a powerhouse capable of dealing upwards of 100 damage per turn. Picking the right Feats can ensure that a character can hold their own against any foe.

Updated January 4, 2025 by Kristy Ambrose : Larian Studios continues to make upgrades and bug fixes to BG3, with Patch 8 scheduled for release in 2025, complete with a new Monk subclass, the Drunken Master.

While the three Monk subclasses provide different flavors of combat, the overall workings of the class tend to fall short of other options, which is where the careful choice of different Feats is involved. Monks are limited to damage and support when it comes to party roles, but a few wise choices of Feats can improve their abilities.

1 Tough

Increased Durability In All Situations

  • Stats: Gain +2 HP per level up and is applied retroactively

It's in a Monk's nature to get up close and personal with the enemy to take advantage of their many skills that only activate when in proximity with hostiles. This naturally has the downside of always putting Monk in the line of fire during combat.

Tough alleviates this weakness a little bit by increasing the number of hit points the Monk gains on every level up. Two additional HP points might not seem like a lot at first glance, but they quickly add up. And since this feat is applied retroactively, there is no downside to picking this up late in a playthrough.

2 Weapon Master

Useful For A Class That Doesnt Use Weapons

  • Stats: Increase either Dexterity or Strength by +1, and gain Proficiency in four Weapon Types of your choice.

One of the reasons that players might be reluctant to play a Monk is because of the lack of weapons. This class is notorious for their combat talents without weapons, but the fact is that Monks can use Simple Weapons and Shortswords, and this can include others depending on the choice of race. Monks that are Elves, for example, can use short bows and longbows.

Weapon Master lets the player choose four more Weapon Types, and popular choices are weapons with a long reach. These include javelins or glaives, which are a step up from simple weapons of a similar design, like a spear. Adding distance weapons is also a wise choice if the character doesn't have extra racial weapon proficiencies.

3 Alert

Ensure A Monk Is Never Surprised

  • Stats: Grants initiative bonus, prevents characters from being surprised

The Alert Feat is a fantastic feat for any character to take, but it's undoubtedly a must-have for any Monk. This feat provides a huge +5 bonus on initiative rolls, which works slightly differently in Baldur's Gate 3 .

Initiative, unlike in the tabletop game, uses a single d4, instead of a d20, and adds a player's dexterity modifier. This means the +5 bonus represents a huge increase in initiative bonus, which almost guarantees that a Monk will be taking action very early in combat.

This Feat pairs very well with any Monk character, who uses Dexterity as their primary ability anyway, meaning the +5 bonus to Initiative will also stack with a Monk's dex modifier on initiative rolls, which allows them to hit early in combat and secure important kills or objectives. Alert also prevents characters from being surprised, which can be great if a Monk needs to jump to the defense of their party after a particularly sneaky ambush.

4 Skilled

Improve Party Weaknesses

  • Stats: Become proficient in two skills of choice, so better to get this Feat at lower levels.

Skilled allows players to pick and choose three skills for their character to become proficient in. Not only is this useful for the party Face, which is the character that will be doing all of the dialogue checks, but it's also useful for exploration and discovery.

Ideally, players should aim to cover all their bases with their party composition and make sure that the members cover each other's weaknesses. The Skilled Feat allows a character to fill in the gaps in a party's proficiencies without having to respec from scratch.

5 Athlete

Improve Core Skills And Movement Abilities

  • Stats: Improve core skills and increase jump distance

The Athlete feat provides a +1 bonus to either Strength or Dexterity, either of which are great options for a Monk to increase. If they opt to increase their strength, this will pay off when they can eventually learn the Savage Attacker feat, or the increase to Dexterity will help with initiative rolls, and ensure their unarmed strikes are hitting more frequently.

That's not all, however, as the Athlete feat uses 50% less movement speed when a character recovers from the Prone condition, and increases their jump distance by a whopping 50%, which allows them to traverse any battlefield with ease, and take out tricky enemies who might be hiding behind cover, or using other enemies as cannon fodder.

6 Ability Score Improvement

Improve A Monk's Dexterity

  • Stats: Improve key skills; one skill by two points, or two skills by one point

Monks use Dexterity as their primary skill, meaning it is critical that players get this stat up as high as they can, as quickly as they can. Baldur's Gate 3 puts some limits in place when creating a character, and as such, players won't be able to increase any skills in the character creation process beyond 17. An Ability Score Improvement can bump this number up by two by level four, providing a meaty +4 bonus to attack rolls.

This is a great improvement, especially to take early on, to ensure a Monk is hitting their target more frequently. When Monks are capable of delivering several attacks per turn, it's of the utmost importance that these attacks are hitting, making the Ability Score Improvement a feat that is not to be slept on.

7 Lucky

Gain The Power Of Luck To Reshape Battles

  • Stats: Turn failures and misses into successes, and grants three Luck points, which can be spent as a reaction

The Lucky feat is unquestionably one of the most powerful feats available in Baldur's Gate 3, and it can work incredibly well for pretty much any class although Monks in particular will get great value from this feat. It grants 3 Luck points to the player, which they can spend when they opt to, which can be used to provide extremely valuable tactical benefits.

It allows the player to gain advantage on saving throws, ability checks, or attack rolls, which can turn a Monk missing their Stunning Strike into a critical success, or it can even force enemies to reroll their attack rolls, which can not only be incredibly useful to save a Monk's skin but can also be used to defend less martially-capable allies like Wizards and Sorcerers.

8 Mage Slayer

Gain the Upper Hand Against Mages

  • Stats: Counter spellcasters, but only triggers in melee range.

Among the many strengths of the Monk Class is their ability to counter specific control spells from enemies through their innate class features like Stillness of Mind and Evasion, giving them the upper hand in encounters against these enemies.

Mage Slayer takes this one step further, allowing Monks to completely counter all mages by giving them the option to use a Reaction to counterattack whenever a spell is cast in close range. The Way of Shadow Monk Subclass is best at this, as Pass Without Trace can allow them to sneak up to enemies very easily, though that isn't a reason not to pick it up for one of the other two subclasses if players find themselves struggling against Wizards.

9 Savage Attacker

Ensure Attacks Hit Harder

  • Stats: Roll damage dice twice and use the higher number.

The Savage Attacker feat is perhaps most useful on a Monk, more than any other class, due to the sheer number of attacks they can dish out on their turn. This feat allows any character who makes a weapon attack to roll their damage dice twice and use the higher result. This effectively provides Advantage on damage rolls, which adds up to incredible numbers throughout a campaign.

With Monks, who can make two attacks with one action by level 5, and can deal additional attacks using their bonus action with ease, this feat quickly pays for itself, as the increased damage begins to stack up pretty quickly. Unfortunately, it does require a Monk to utilize a melee weapon for the damage roll to roll twice, but using a Quarterstaff or some other martial weapon makes this feat incredibly valuable.

10 Mobile

Glide Across The Battlefield With Ease

  • Stats: Increases movement speed and prevents reduced speed on difficult terrain while dashing.

The Mobile Feat allows Monks to traverse the battlefield with ease, which is a skill not to be underestimated. This Feat grants a significant increase in movement speed and prevents Monks from being impeded by difficult terrain when dashing. This pairs beautifully with a Monk's Step of The Wind ability, which allows them to double their movement speed and jump without using a bonus action.

This feat can ensure Monks are placed away from danger. After all, they aren't the best at tanking hits like a Barbarian or Fighter might be, and place themselves against spellcasters in the backline, or characters providing buffs. This feat brings incredible versatility to a Monk and ensures they aren't caught with their pants down, so to speak.

11 Resilient

Ideal For Any Melee Fighter

  • Stats: Increase any ability by +1 choose one and gain Proficiency in that ability's saving throws.

Monks usually fight in close quarters, which means they need extra Constitution, Dexterity, and better Saving Throws for those abilities. Resilient is the Feat that gives the Monk this extra protection, and it's better to get at earlier levels to make combat and progression a bit easier.

Most players will choose Dexterity in this case, but if this build is more about combat, Constitution will give the character some extra hit points, so it's worth considering. It combines well with other ideal Feats for Monks, like Tavern Brawler and Tough.

12 Tavern Brawler

Increase A Monk's Unarmed Attack Damage

  • Stats: Adds Strength modifier to damage rolls and improves Strength or Constitution

Tavern Brawler is almost a prerequisite for playing as a Monk because the bonus gained from this feat is so ridiculously strong that it would be silly not to take it. The Tavern Brawler Feat allows players to dish out additional damage if their attacks meet specific requirements, and one is perfect for a Monk.

Monks with Tavern Brawler can add their Strength modifier to not only their attack rolls but their damage too. When delivering multiple attacks per turn utilizing their Flurry of Blows ability, this can add up. It's especially great for any players who build their Monk towards a Strength-based character. This feat also provides a nice +1 bonus to either Strength or Constitution scores, which is a nice bonus on top of an already incredible feat.

item.title: In Which Order Should You Play God of War Games
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All God Of War Games In The Series
  • Most Popular Orders To Play The God Of War Games
  • Best Order To Play The God Of War Games
  • Alternate Order To Play God Of War Games

If you’re new to the God of War series and thinking about exploring its rich world, you might be wondering where to start. With over half a dozen games, spanning the Greek Saga and the Norse Saga, deciding where to begin can feel overwhelming.

Fans often have differing opinions — some suggest skipping the Greek games and diving straight into the new Norse Saga, while others view that as sacrilege. Fortunately, the guide below will help you discover the best order to experience the God of War series, ensuring you don’t miss out on any of its epic moments.

All God Of War Games In The Series

There are 10 God of War games in total, but only eight are essential . Two titles can be skipped without missing any significant story or gameplay: God of War: Betrayal (2007) , a mobile game with limited impact on the narrative, and God of War: A Call from the Wilds (2018) , a Facebook-based text adventure. The rest of the games are key to experiencing Kratos' full journey.

  1. God of War 1
  2. God of War 2
  3. God of War 3
  4. God of War: Chains of Olympus
  5. God of War: Ghost of Sparta
  6. God of War: Ascension
  7. God of War (2018)
  8. God of War Ragnarok

Most Popular Orders To Play The God Of War Games

When it comes to playing a long-running series like God of War , there are two main approaches: release order or chronological order . With several titles serving as prequels to the main trilogy, it’s natural to wonder which method offers the best experience for diving into these critically acclaimed games.

Release Order

Playing in release order is straightforward: simply follow the order in which the games were originally launched. This is how most long-time fans experienced the series. Keep in mind, however, that some titles, like Chains of Olympus and Ghost of Sparta , don’t match the production quality of the main trilogy. Playing the games in release order also allows players to experience the natural evolution of gameplay mechanics and design improvements as the series progressed.

The release order is as follows:

  1. God of War 1 (2005)
  2. God of War 2 (2007)
  3. God of War: Chains of Olympus (2008)
  4. God of War 3 (2010)
  5. God of War: Ghost of Sparta (2010)
  6. God of War: Ascension (2013)
  7. God of War (2018)
  8. God of War Ragnarok (2022)
  9. God of War Ragnarök Valhalla Mode (2023)

Chronological Order

If you're more invested in the story aspect of the God of War series, playing in chronological order is the way to go. However, be prepared for some graphic and gameplay whiplash as you jump between games with varying levels of polish. The starting game is also widely regarded as the weakest in the series, so don’t judge the entire franchise based on your first experience.

The chronological order is as follows:

  1. God of War: Ascension
  2. God of War: Chains of Olympus
  3. God of War 1
  4. God of War: Ghost of Sparta
  5. God of War 2
  6. God of War 3
  7. God of War (2018)
  8. God of War Ragnarok
  9. God of War Ragnarok: Valhalla (Free DLC)

Best Order To Play The God Of War Games

While there’s no one-size-fits-all answer that will satisfy every fan — some may even be strongly opposed to it — the order listed below takes both narrative and gameplay into account. This approach ensures that new players won’t feel overwhelmed or burned out by the series. We recommend playing the God of War games in the following order:

  1. God of War 1
  2. God of War: Chains of Olympus
  3. God of War: Ghost of Sparta
  4. God of War 2
  5. God of War 3
  6. God of War: Ascension
  7. God of War (2018)
  8. God of War Ragnarok
  9. God of War Ragnarok Valhalla Mod e

Start with the original God of War , but don’t jump straight into its sequel. Instead, play its prequel, Chains of Olympus , followed by Ghost of Sparta (which takes place after the first game). Next, play God of War 2 and God of War 3 — it’s important to play these two consecutively, as the third game picks up immediately after the second. After finishing God of War 3 , move on to Ascension to complete the Greek Saga.

From there, the order is straightforward: play God of War (2018) , followed by Ragnarok , and then dive into the excellent Valhalla DLC in Ragnarok .

As mentioned earlier, God of War: Ascension is considered the weakest in the series . If you’re not enjoying it, you might want to consider skipping it and watching a recap on YouTube to catch up on its story. However, Ascension does feature some impressive, over-the-top action, so it’s still recommended to push through if you can.

Alternate Order To Play God Of War Games

While the older God of War games are some of the best that PlayStation has to offer, no one would blame you for not enjoying them, as they are somewhat dated. There's an alternative order that can ease you into the God of War universe: playing the Norse Saga before the Greek Saga .

While many fans would consider this blasphemy (and not without reason), there’s a compelling argument for it. The Norse games feature improved combat, higher production value, gorgeous visuals, and, interestingly, not knowing the context of the Greek games can add a sense of mystery to the narratives of both God of War (2018) and Kratos’ tragic past.

The alternate way to play the God of War games is as follows:

  1. God of War (2018)
  2. God of War Ragnarok
  3. God of War Ragnarok Valhalla Mod e
  4. God of War: Ascension
  5. God of War: Chains of Olympus
  6. God of War 1
  7. God of War: Ghost of Sparta
  8. God of War 2
  9. God of War 3
